channel.title: Help, Environmental Variables!
channel.description:
Hey,
I recently tried to make a private serv, i changed my variables because of JDK, and well, i decided to give it up.
Now, i cant play any clients because of an error " 'JAVA' Is not recognized as an internal or external command, Operable program Or Batch file."
Any ideas to return CLASSPATH and PATH variables back to normal, or get shut of this stupid error?
Im on vista, And on a laptop :| :confused:

item.title: Help, Environmental Variables!
item.dc:creator: @BeforeHell BeforeHell
item.description:
@BeforeHell wrote:

K, Im back online,

It just states ‘Java’ , Not ‘Javac’ Cos i havent used to compile yet, Cos i cant even get past this bit >.<

Read full topic

item.title: Help, Environmental Variables!
item.dc:creator: @bryanc Bryanc
item.description:
@bryanc wrote:

That would be because JDK includes JRE.

Read full topic

item.title: Help, Environmental Variables!
item.dc:creator: @Linksbro Linksbro
item.description:
@Linksbro wrote:

I don’t have JRE, I can run java files with a JDK path.
IE: java HelloWorld

Read full topic

item.title: Help, Environmental Variables!
item.dc:creator: @bryanc Bryanc
item.description:
@bryanc wrote:

[quote=“Linksbro, post:10, topic:230053”]ENVIRONMENTAL VARIABLES ARE USED TO SET YOUR PATH TO JDK SO YOU CAN COMPILE \ RUN YOUR SERVER.

Now please stop acting like you know everything about Private servers, kthx?[/quote][quote=“Linksbro, post:12, topic:230053”]“Java” and “Javac” will work if you set your path to a JDK, JRE is not for private servers though.[/quote]

False,

JRE is Java Runtime Environment, It IS needed to run any java application. IE: a private server.

LARDI:

Any ideas to return CLASSPATH and PATH variables back to normal, or get shut of this stupid error?

The error won’t go away unless you set the Path correctly. Which was stated 5 times.

Read full topic

item.title: Help, Environmental Variables!
item.dc:creator: @bryanc Bryanc
item.description:
@bryanc wrote:

LARDI:

idiot, jdk wont help u if the 1st didnt help…and this helped me and hes asking for the normal 1s not jdk idiot

First of all, I know more than you.

Second of all, Don’t call me an idiot.

@ Beforehell,

Does it say, ‘java is not recognized’ or ‘javac is not recognized’

If it said Java, then you need to set JRE paths.
If it said Javac, then you need to set JDK paths.

PS: Vista is NOT the problem. A laptop is NOT the problem…

Why does everyone say Vista is different for running a server. It’s the same exact thing!

[quote=“Linksbro, post:10, topic:230053”]ENVIRONMENTAL VARIABLES ARE USED TO SET YOUR PATH TO JDK SO YOU CAN COMPILE \ RUN YOUR SERVER.

Now please stop acting like you know everything about Private servers, kthx?[/quote]

clap clap clap

Read full topic

item.title: Help, Environmental Variables!
item.dc:creator: @Linksbro Linksbro
item.description:
@Linksbro wrote:

LARDI, You don’t know shit about Environment Variables, please gtfo.

Download any version of JDK,

Open a CMD and set your path by typing

path C:\program files\java\JDK1.6.0_07\bin;

**NOTE Insert your version of JDK in that text

Set your folder path

cd C:\Figmentscape

**NOTE Replace with what your folder path is

Your CMD should now look like,

C:\Figmentscape>

Now type,
javac *.java

This should compile, and then type,
java server

Which should run your server.

Fool Proof Compiler guide for the weak.

-Linksbro

Read full topic

no, because it wont work, that happened to me, change to to C:\Windows\System32;C:\Windows;C:\Windows\System32\Wbem

No that’s false… There is not even a jdk path in that. So you’re wrong, now just stop. I am right, you’re wrong.
